parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A prison. From a derivative of desmon; a place of bondage, i.e. A dungeon.
Safety, security, reliability, firmness. From asphales; security.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To shut, shut up. A primary verb; to close.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A guard, keeper, sentinel. From phulasso; a watcher or sentry.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
Within, inside, with verbs either of rest or of motion; prep: within, to within, inside. From eis; inside.
